meanings.definition: To divide into two branches or forks.
meanings.sent1: The river will furcate into two smaller streams.
meanings.sent2: I watched the tree furcate into two separate branches.
meanings.sent3: The road furcated like a fork in the path, confusing the travelers.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to furcate her career led to new opportunities.
meanings.sent5: The lightning seemed to furcate the sky, splitting it in two.

meanings.sent1: The furcate tree provided shade with its many branches.
meanings.sent2: The furcate antlers of the deer were a majestic sight.
meanings.sent3: The furcate road sign pointed in two different directions.
meanings.sent4: Her furcate hairstyle was unique and eye-catching.
meanings.sent5: The furcate lightning struck the ground, creating a stunning display.
